Symbolic links: </ref> NTFS 3.0 (Windows 2000) and higher can create junctions  which allow entire directories (but not individual files) to be mapped to elsewhere in the directory tree of the same partition (file system). These are implemented through reparse points  which allow the normal process of filename resolution to be extended in a flexible manner.}}

Case-sensitive: </ref> HFS Plus version 5 optionally supports case-sensitivity. However  since case-sensitivity is fundamentally different from case-insensitivity  a new signature was required so existing HFS Plus utilities would not see case-sensitivity as a file system error that needed to be corrected. Since the new signature is 'HX'  it is often believed this is a new filesystem instead of a simply an upgraded version of HFS Plus.<ref> (hasn't been updated to discuss HFSX)</ref><ref> (Very technical overview of HFS Plus and HFSX.)</ref>}}
